title: "If you can't play with friends, don't play at all" - Rito Games
body:
So the new dynamic queue is out, and it's already being slammed (rightfully) for causing massively unfair matchups. By allowing queues of 4-5 people to be matched up against solo players, there seems to be no logical reason to play solo in ranked anymore. Unfortunately, I'm one of those weirdos who actually enjoys playing alone. I didn't want to slam Riot right away for screwing over solo players, so I went to look for their rationale, which is where i found this gem:

"With the new Champ Select experience, we're giving players more benefits than ever before to play with friends because *we believe playing with friends is the right way to enjoy League*--we don't want the game to become an anti-social experience."

Oh. Oh sorry Riot, didn't realize that I was empirically playing your game wrong by preferring to play by myself. I guess I'll just go stand in the corner while I wait for my 4 minute queue to pop so  can lose to a 5 man queue with vastly superior communication.

/rant

About a year or a year and a half ago they were looking into it, I think. It was only on the PBE for a little while, but they also did a lot of surveying of players. According to Riot, most players didn't really want to deal with voice chat with strangers, they actually only wanted to do it with friends, and when they did tests with voice chat, toxicity went up an incredible amount.

They never had any kind of public tests with league players. No voice chat ever went on the PBE. They did internal tests and studied people using the Curse voice program. You need 5 players to start a game.
A premade with 4 players has for players.
5 - 4 = 1
They need one player. A solo player.
